subject: Politics
title: Social Media and Protest
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Social Media and Protest.

hook.text: Egypt's revolution was organized on Facebook. Then the government shut down the internet. The protest continued anyway.

buildup.text: Social media helps protesters organize, share information, and attract global attention in real time.

discovery.text: The #MeToo movement, Hong Kong protests, and Black Lives Matter all spread through social media at viral speed.

twist.text: Governments learned to use social media too. China floods platforms with pro-state content to drown out dissent.

climax.text: Social media mobilizes fast but builds shallow movements. Online outrage fades; lasting change needs real organizing.

punchline.text: Social media starts movements fast. Sustaining them still takes real work.

quiz.question: What is a key weakness of social media-driven movements?
options: They mobilize quickly but often lack sustained organizational depth
They are always more successful than traditional organizing
Governments cannot monitor social media activity
